message_1: How many ways can you choose 3 out of 10 different colors and paint a fence with those colors if each color can be used multiple times?
message_2:
Since each color can be used multiple times, we can use the combination with repetition formula to solve this problem. The formula for combinations with repetition is:

C(n + r - 1, r) = C(n + r - 1, n - 1)

where n is the number of different colors (10 in this case) and r is the number of colors to be chosen (3 in this case).

C(10 + 3 - 1, 3) = C(12, 3) = 12! / (3! * (12 - 3)!)

C(12, 3) = 12! / (3! * 9!)

C(12, 3) = (12 * 11 * 10 * 9!)/(3! * 9!)

C(12, 3) = (12 * 11 * 10)/(3 * 2 * 1)

C(12, 3) = 220

So, there are 220 ways to choose 3 out of 10 different colors and paint a fence with those colors if each color can be used multiple times.
